oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1958-12-13 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from December 13, 1958. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Faron Young (host/performer) with Donny Young, guest performers Lonzo & Oscar, and regular performers the Jordanaires, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl, and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1001st broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Faron Young; Jordanaires; Lonzo & Oscar; Tommy Jackson; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Faron Young -- Last Night At A Party (Faron Young) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Faron Young) -- Faron Young introduces the Jordanaires -- This Little Light Of Mine (Jordanaires) -- Faron Young introduces Lonzo & Oscar -- Things Look Silly (Lonzo & Oscar) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Faron Young) -- Faron Young introduces Tommy Jackson -- Leather Britches (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Faron Young talks -- How Long Has It Been (Faron Young, Jordanaires) -- Faron Young introduces Chet Atkins -- Farewell Blues (Chet Atkins) -- Faron Young introduces Minnie Pearl
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Minnie Pearl; Atkins, Chet; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Jackson, Tommy; Jordanaires (Musical group); Paycheck, Johnny; Young, Faron; Lonzo and Oscar
